preparationSteps: Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them with a fork or whisk until the whites and yolks are fully combined.
Season the eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and add the butter or oil. Once the butter has melted or the oil is hot, add the eggs to the skillet.
Use a spatula to gently scramble the eggs, constantly stirring and scraping the bottom of the skillet until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
Serve the scrambled eggs hot, with toast or on a bed of greens.

ingredients.name: Slices of Cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or any cheese of your choice)

preparationSteps: Lay the bread slices on a flat surface, and place a slice of cheese on top of each of two slices of bread.
Place the remaining two slices of bread on top of the cheese, creating a sandwich.
Heat a skillet over medium heat, and add the butter or margarine.
Once the butter or margarine is melted, add the sandwich to the skillet.
Grill the sandwich until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Cut the sandwich in half and serve it warm.
Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the ground beef or turkey over medium heat. Drain the excess fat.
Add the onion and garlic to the pot and saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 15 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pot and toss to coat the pasta with the sauce.
Serve the spaghetti with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese on top, if desired.
